intro: Peucedanum triternatum var. robustius, commonly known as the robust giant angelica, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its tall, branched stems and large, pinnately compound leaves. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and thrives in temperate climates with well-drained soils. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties. The species is notable for its robust growth and is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
